Activity: Arrive at the office. Check emails and calendar for urgent matters. Prioritize tasks based on urgency and impact.
Review project plan from Week 1, noting progress and any deviations. Identify areas requiring immediate attention.
Email @COO-1, @CIO-1 seeking alignment on project priorities for Week 2. Request a brief meeting to discuss overall strategic direction.
Prepare agenda for meeting with COO and CIO, focusing on key achievements from Week 1, potential roadblocks, and adjustments to the overall project plan.
Meeting with @COO-1 and @CIO-1 to discuss project progress, challenges, and strategic alignment for Week 2. Document key decisions and action items.

Send email to all team leads (@larch-1, @qres-1, @dsde-1, @comp-1, @ir-1, @onbd-1) summarizing the meeting with COO and CIO. Request individual team leads to cascade information to their respective teams.

Draft a template for SMART goals to be used by all team members. Ensure template includes sections for specific tasks, measurable outcomes, achievable targets, relevance to project goals, and defined timelines.
Lunch. Catch up on industry news related to quantitative finance and statistical arbitrage.
Send email to all team members with the SMART goal template. Emphasize the importance of individual goals aligning with overall project objectives. Set a deadline of EOD Tuesday for submission.
Schedule individual brief meetings with each team lead (@larch-1, @qres-1, @dsde-1, @comp-1, @ir-1, @onbd-1) for Wednesday to discuss and refine SMART goals.
Review Week 1 deliverables from each team. Identify any gaps or areas needing improvement. Document findings for discussion with team leads.
Update the project plan document with refined timelines, resource allocation, and risk assessments based on Week 1 progress and discussions with COO/CIO.
Prepare a summary report for COO and CIO outlining the refined project plan, key decisions from today's meetings, and upcoming activities for Week 2.
Finalize daily tasks and prepare for tomorrow's schedule.
